name: King Oscar II and Sophia Celebrate their Silver Wedding Anniversary
obverse: Busts of king and queen facing right.
obverse_inscriptions: OSCAR II ET SOPHIA REX ET REGINA SVECIÆ ET NORVEGIÆ
reverse: The royal couple's monogram, enclosed by a rose sprig, all under a royal crown. Around this, rays of light and a masonic chain; train with four knots and with a tassel at each end.
reverse_inscriptions: PROTECTORI ET FRATRI EXCELSISSIMO OPTIMO MEMORIAM CONIUGII PER XXV ANNOS PROSPERRIMI CELEBRANTI FRATRES LIBERI CÆMENTAREII SVECIÆ ET NORVEGIÆ DIE VI IUNII A. MDCCCLXXXII.
description: Oscar II (Oscar Fredrik; 21 January 1829 – 8 December 1907) was King of Sweden from 1872 until his death in 1907 and King of Norway from 1872 to 1905.
He married his wife Sophia in 1857.
